long: Meaning: to "clap" the hands (in token of compact, derision, grief, indignation, or punishment); by implication of satisfaction, to "be enough"; by implication of excess, to "vomit".  Usage: clap, smite, strike, suffice, wallow.  Source: or "שָׂפַק"; (1 Kings 20:10; Job 27:23; Isaiah 2:6), a primitive root;
